shell.title: Introduction to AP Psychology: The Course

scene.credits: (l to r)Ariel Skelley/Blend Images/Getty Images, (2)Ross Taylor/Getty Images News/Getty Images, (3)Sergei Bachlakov/Getty Images News/Getty Images, (4)Hank Morgan/Photo Researchers, Inc., (5)David Riecks/age fotostock, (6)Richard T. hotspots.hotspot: Psychologists work on the cutting edge of modern brain science.
Psychologists debate the nature and meaning of mental illness.
Psychologists investigate how the Internet and the Web affect our thinking processes.
Psychologists study the best ways to educate children and the best ways to help seniors keep their intellects sharp.
Psychologists help workers deal with lay-offs and help immigrants find their way in a new culture.
Psychologists create measures of job satisfaction and ways to motivate employees.
Psychologists help create human interfaces with automobiles and video games.

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

drops.drop: How does a person with Internet addition plan and conduct Internet searches?
Does a person with Internet addition unconsciously relish the unlimited opportunities on the Internet because his father was extremely controlling?
Does a person with Internet addition vicariously seek relationships through Internet stories and photos?
A person experiences mood-altering effects from chemical changes in the brain when using the Internet.
One teen observes the behavior of a peer on the Internet and desires to replicate what he or she observed.
When her friends all rave about the new photos on a social network, a young woman decides to go see them for herself.

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers.'

content.instruction:
Clinical: the diagnosis and treatment of illness

Clinical professionals use the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders to guide their diagnosis of patients.

A clinical psychologist will consider the patient's situation from different perspectives (5 axes).

hotspots.hotspot: Axis 1 documents the patient's symptoms of most psychological disorders.
Axis 2 specifically looks at whether the patient shows symptoms of mental retardation or a certain class of psychological disorders called personality disorders.
Axis 3 is concerned with medical conditions that may contribute to the patient's psychological distress.
Axis 4 is used for reporting social or environmental issues that may contribute to the patient's psychological distress.

Axis 5 is used for assessing the patient's ability to function in the world â€“ at school, at work, in relationships, and in personal care. It is referred to as the General Assessment of Functioning (GAF).

scene.credits: (tr)Brand X Pictures/PunchStock, (c)Lewis J. Merrim/Photo Researchers, Inc., (bkgd)Glow Images/Getty Images.

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

matches.match: Axis 1 documents symptoms of most psychological disorders.
Axis 2 looks for symptoms of personality disorders.
Axis 3 is concerned with medical conditions.
Axis 4 is concerned with social or environmental issues.

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers.'

multiple.question: Not much has changed in the field of psychology in the last 20 years.
Taking AP Psychology could help you get admitted to the college you prefer.
Psychologists use three perspectives as a way to organize the vast field of psychology.
Behavioral, evolutionary, and humanistic are examples of different types of psychological perspectives.
Clinical professionals use the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders to guide their diagnoses of patients.
